info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 01 at 9:24PM PDT until September 02 at 1:30AM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Clark County in southern Nevada... * Until 130 AM PDT. * At 924 PM PDT, Emergency management officials reported extensive flash flooding around the Las Vegas Valley from thunderstorms producing heavy rainfall earlier this evening which produced between 1 and 2 inches of rain over western parts of the metro area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, flood channels, normally dry washes, and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Las Vegas, Henderson, North Las Vegas, Enterprise, Paradise, Mountains Edge, Southern Highlands, Downtown Las Vegas, Summerlin, Green Valley, Lone Mountain, Anthem, Blue Diamond, East Las Vegas, Aliante, Centennial Hills. It is requested by emergency management officials that motorists stay off the roads due to extensive ongoing flooding and water rescues. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
